item.title: WebAPI Wildcard In Route
item.description: I recently discovered that it’s possible to include a wildcard (the * character) in a WebApi route. It looks something like: [Route(some/route/{*key})] This ASP.Net article has a good example (search for the ‘wildcard’ section). Essentially, everything beyond the route/ part of the url will be assigned to the key variable. For example, the route some/route/more/parts/here?param=1 results in key = "more/parts/here?param=1"; This can be useful for things like file storage and other uri params that may include folder paths or similar.
